intro: Dracaena lancea, commonly known as the lanceleaf dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, including South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a glossy sheen. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the tips of the stems. Dracaena lancea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
